author: Retired politician
title: Prioritisation of flu jabs
body:
I am n shock to learn that NHS Lanarkshire are prioritizing over 65’s and leaving older people till December. I am 79 with type 2 diabetes and high blood pressure. Younger friends have had their jabs weeks past.  
Is this the system you will use when a Covid vaccine is found.

author: DHP
title: Quick and professional
body: I hurt my knee fairly badly and called 111. They had a specialist physician call me back who said I needed to speak to my GP within three days. My GP had no available appointments on the website so I called reception the next morning. They were very busy but had my GP call me back within a few hours. We talked about my symptoms and he referred me the same day to the muskuloskelatal clinic where I had an initial treatment plan within two days. All online so far but helpful. At every stage my treatment was quick and professional and I feel very reassured. I am especially pleased with the way that reception and then Dr. Slater at the practice took seriously my problem, understood what I was saying and arranged for care. I was surprised how effective the virtual care was.

author: MothernotAdopter
title: Consent form for child’s flu vaccination
body: The wording under parental responsibility on your consent for health reviews and immunisation school children form should be reviewed. It calls out specifically legally adoptive parents. As a legally adoptive parent I am his mother - there is no confusion about this. This line in your form is offensive. Birth mother is nowhere on the form so I’m not sure why you’re calling out adoptive parents separately - it is frustrating.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: mcdonald
title: Delayed appointment
body:
When I saw the consultant in March 2020 I was told that there was a 12 week target for my treatment. I was finally treated on 6th October 2020.  
I have no complaint about this as it was entirely due to the onset of lockdown and subsequent restrictions.  
I am extremely grateful to all NHS staff involved in my treatment which went well.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Kerry2020
title: First time parents - Wheal Fortune ward
body:
After giving birth to a breech baby at 36 weeks on delivery suite, my baby needed additional support in his first few days and so I was transferred to Wheal Fortune where I stayed for 7 days in October 2020.  
For the entirety of my stay here, the staff have been nothing short of amazing. My baby was so well cared for, as was I. The staff, both midwives and MSWs, were understanding, supportive, professional, caring and quite frankly, utterly amazing. Not only did they provide exceptional care for my baby - conducting 4 hourly observations, assessing him daily, undertaking numerous tests to ensure he was making good progress and giving him any medical interventions that he needed, they also provided incredible support for me.  
Due to giving birth in the pandemic, restrictions meant that my partner was only able to visit me for three hours a day (for which, I am so grateful). However, I never felt alone or unsupported. I was incredibly emotional at times - a combination of tiredness, feeling overwhelmed as a new mum and the shock of having a baby four weeks earlier than I expected! However, the incredible staff were so understanding and supportive and anything I asked for, was provided - usually I didn’t even need to ask! Considering I was on a hospital ward, I felt quite at home. The staff were so friendly and knew what was happening with my baby and me which shows what professionals they are and how extensive the handovers were - at no point did I not feel confident in their care.  
Not only did the midwives and MSWs provide excellent medical care for our baby and emotional support for me, they were so approachable and knowledgeable, I would often ask for advice on things such as feeding, sleeping and general new mum worries which were always answered patiently and extensively and made me feel much more confident in my abilities as a new parent.  
Another fantastic part of Wheal Fortune is The Nest. The infant feeding team were absolutely incredible. I received such brilliant support from them and for my entire stay the team spent numerous hours with me to help me with breastfeeding, something I was so keen to do but found I struggled with. On my discharge from hospital, they set me up with a plan to help me continue at home and in my first days at home, even telephoned me to check in and see how I was and how breastfeeding was going, going above and beyond what was expected from us.  
The other staff in Treliske were also fantastic and I was visited by the midwives, obstetricians and anesthetists that had been with me on my delivery to see how I was following the birth. I had no expectations of this happening and it was such an appreciated gesture.  
The catering staff were also fantastic, they took such great care of me and were friendly and kind - often checking that I was adequately fed and watered and even knew how I took my tea! Again, the cleaners were friendly and would always have a quick chat and ask how I was each morning - again something I never expected but so appreciated.  
Being admitted to transitional care following the birth of our baby was not something I expected to happen and as a new parent, very daunting and overwhelming. However, every single person that I came into contact with on Wheal Fortune was professional, caring, knowledgeable and friendly. I am so, so grateful to all of the midwives and MSWs for proving such exceptional care to me and my baby and for being such a strong, emotional support for me at a time when I was at my most vulnerable. I cannot thank them enough and will be forever grateful to them for getting our little man fit and healthy and ready to come home with us.

author: TM68
title: Breathingspace.scot
body:
I have used the Breathingspace.scot Webchat a few times recently.  
The opportunity to chat anonymously via a chat function is great as I would never contemplate making contact by telephone.  
The advisors I have spoken to have been wonderful; very patient and empathetic. I've felt listened to and supported.  
However, there are a few issues that massively impact on my emotional state when I need support.  
I realise that Webchat is a pilot project but it is almost impossible to speak with an advisor. Usually the chat button is not there which means you can't connect. As I said previously, I feel that speaking to someone by phone is not helpful for me when I feel that I need support.  
On more than a few occasions, the button has told me I am first in the queue. I have waited for 5-10 minutes on occasion only for a message saying nobody is available to chat.  
One thing I find incredibly difficult to answer is when an advisor opens the conversation by saying "what can I do for you today?", or "how are you today?" I find these very difficult to answer. I don't know what the best way to open a conversation is, but I have disconnected a couple of times after being incapable of replying.  
Finally, recently there have been episodes when the conversation freezes and I have to close down the app to fix it. Usually, the conversation reappears but twice I have lost the conversation. I use a Samsung S20 which runs well so I do wonder if it is a glitch in the app.  
Overall, when I can connect, I can't fault the support given on Breathingspace.scot. I just feel that the availability via Webchat can cause more emotional problems.

author: Lenagrant
title: The shortcomings of Mental Health Services
body: First of all I have a complaint on the shortcomings of Mental Health Services. I am now in my 70s and at age 68 I was advised by my Acute Care Consultant that they could no longer see me and would have to hand me over to the Older Peoples Service. The relationship with the OAS service never really got off the ground and I felt I was not being listened to. For example, I mentioned I had been physically assaulted by a man, a very large man, who pushed me at a party because I spurned his advances. Contact of course in Mental Health is frugal and limited and I was granted only an annual visit. The following year I told of a very serious sexual assault on me and the reply was just that they were sorry to hear this. End. I have mulled this over and over in my mind and have now decided to get private therapy whilst no longer wishing to carry on with an annual appointment from medical professionals who do not seem to care, or/and do not have the capacity to deal with a patient who comes with acute issues outwith their capability.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
University of Stirling, Faculty of Social Sciences

author: Joe Mama
title: Most of the worrying was unnecessary
body: I got stressed out about basically everything and anything happening in my life. I couldn't get through the day without worrying. I gradually realised, with the help of the Emotional Wellbeing Service, that most of the worrying was unnecessary and that I was doing just fine.

author: Juleah
title: Could plain English be used in hospital letters
body:
Just a quick comment about an outpatient appointment letter received from FVRH recently.  
The letter said “BAU contingency clinic...”, which caused slight confusion and anxiety for my relative.Just wondered if it would be good to avoid abbreviations and use plain English.

author: AEG2020
title: Insensitive to my situation
body:
Early miscarriage with surgical management.Wishaw Early Pregnancy Assessment department were excellent in their care and compassion at our time of loss.  
Due to covid rules I had to have a test 72 hours before surgery, which I am fine with. But that timeline fell on a weekend and the EPA unit was closed. That meant I had to attend for the test at maternity triage. When I got there, I was shown into a room with a labour bed and newborn cot. Given I was still carrying my baby who had died the week before and dealing with the grief and loss, putting me in this room to wait until a nurse was free to do the test was painful, distressing (I cried the whole time I was waiting) and insensitive to my situation.  
I have heard that others have also experienced this.  
To help other women to avoid this additional distress in this situation please could weekend covid tests on miscarriage patients be done in a consulting room, or really any room but a labour suite.  
Thank you.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: Rdl
title: Staff went above and beyond
body: I had a planned section in June 2020 during the covid pandemic. I received  my antenatal care privately but was admitted to Craigavon Area Hospital Matetnity Ward on a number of occasions during my pregnancy as I suffered with a lot of sickness resulting in bouts of dehydration. The care I received during these admissions and then during delivery and post-natally was excellent. Staff went above and beyond. Dr Shahid and all the staff in Maternity Assessment and the ward are beacons for our NHS and I cannot thank them enough. They should be very proud of themselves.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jilll
title: Put at ease straight away
body: Was very nervous but put at ease by jess straight away and when in consultation miss Harper was very reassuring and respectful. Both were compassionate and caring. I was fully informed of the findings,

title: Good flu jab process - calm and smooth
body:
I attended a timed flu jab session on Monday 19th October. There was a queue of other people who seemed all good natured and patient.
The process was extremely simple and easy, the flow good and the atmosphere relaxed.  As well as the doctors administering the jabs, there were other staff who were checking temperatures and directing people.   I felt well looked after, having been initially contacted and offered the jab, then given a set time and then going through the well organised process.  Thanks to all those involved.

title: Always helpful
body: My wife and I arrived for our annual flu jab and we were met with welcoming staff and the injections were administered before we knew it.  In these troubles times the staff showed great spirit and professionalism.  Many thanks.

title: Brilliant practice
body:
I had my second cataract operation and now I can see and read properly again. 
The whole team at Spa Medica are extremely polite, friendly and efficient. I would highly recommend them to everybody who needs cataract treatment. First class.

title: Excellent experience
body: On Saturday 17th October 2020, along my wife, I attended the practice for our winter influenza inoculation.  We both wish to congratulate and thank all of the hard working ladies involved for having organised and delivered a most streamlined, efficient and good natured mass treatment process. Even the inoculation was painless!

title: Nice new nurse
body: I went into have my flu shot and was met by a new nurse, she was understanding as I was not comfortable in an almost enclosed room...no windows. She was gentle, so much so that the antiviral stung/burnt but the needle was almost unfelt. Nice nurse thank you.

title: Faultless
body: Cannot praise our St Richards Hospital enough. Visit to A&E again today until the early hours. Having 4 children we have been regular 'customers' for over 20 years. From breaks to lifesaving surgery, we are so thankful to have them on our doorstep in Chichester. Sometimes it takes time to be seen as there are maybe others that prioritise with an illness, but we are in the right place, with staff who are doing their best  not just because it's their job but because their hearts are in it too 💙

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Alicha
title: There should be someone available in person
body: My 14 year old daughter was referred to CAMHS in Feb and is still waiting to see someone. Counselling by telephone does not work for her. She needs a proper assessment and subsequent treatment. I understand that, where possible people should work from home/remotely but this is obviously not working for all patients and there should be someone available in person when required. I am concerned that her recovery rate will be severely affected by the length of time this is taking. I feel very frustrated/angry that as a key worker I am expected to deal with 200 plus people each shift but it's impossible to find one person willing to sit with a young girl and help her get through this very difficult/dangerous time.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

author: Sportytart
title: Unacceptable change of product
body: Incontinence service is wanting to change my disabled son's pads to unacceptable other sort.My son is in a residental home and was told he had to have an incontinence assessement he is 20 yrs old and had the pull up pants for 5yrs they meet his needs and dignity and enable him to progress ie pull them up or down. The nurse that did the assessment started by saying we could not have this product and my son had to go to taped pad which he had tried years before and were unsuitable My son wasn't even seen in person and they were very abrupt. I asked who to complain to and was told that they didn’t know because no one had before. Disgraceful service.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Clb17
title: Dermatology
body: I had a phone appointment with my GP,   then emailed in photos of a suspicious lesion. I was referred to the Dermatology Department at the New Victoria Hospital, and had an appointment within a month. I was seen by Dr Drummond, lesion biopsied and back in my car, all within 30 minutes. The clinic was incredibly efficient, all staff were very friendly and caring.

author: incommunicative
title: Covid test results
body:
Recently was in admissions 1 where various tests carried out including a covid test  
I was allowed to go home and told to isolate until the hospital phoned me with the result of my covid test Almost 2 weeks down the line and I am still awaiting a call.  
After 48 hours I decided to phone my GP and Low and behold they had the result therefore able to tell me negative. Just as well I decided to phone the doc or would have been in isolation for 2 weeks and off work waiting on tele call.  
The doctor and staff were amazing and very attentive shame about the communication.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: BillS20
title: I have terminal Hodgkin’s Lymphoma
body: I was diagnosed with lymphoma in 2018 which I had 6 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy unfortunately in October 2019 it progressed so they put me on palliative care and I am pleased to say they are doing everything they can for me.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Md82
title: Attendance at Xray department
body:
Last week i had to bring my son to hospital as he had went over on his ankle. We saw a nurse who assessed him as needing an xray. Once brought round to xray we were brought into the xray room, i was told to come in for the xray because of my sons age. I was amazed to find the xray room had 7 xray staff!! All were wearing PPE but as I had to be brought into the room myself and 7 staff were crammed in behind a small partitioned corner of the room. During the xrays staff had to squeeze in and out past me. Other staff were talking about their lives outside of work. There was no social distancing between the 7 staff and myself.  
Is this standard practice to have 7 staff members taking xrays for one patient?  
I also do not think it appropriate to discuss personal matters in front of patients. Completely inappropriate.  
Care from the nursing staff in casualty was fantastic However xray appears over staffed, no social distancing and not very professional.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Powerless
title: Mental health care
body:
I was referred to community psychiatric nurse and psychiatrist on reporting feeling depressed. I was prescribed anti depressants by psychiatrist and seen twice but not seen again by psychiatrist in subsequent 12 months.  
Community nurse offered attending employment training which I didn't want. They never followed up whether I was safe after a year.  
On reflection I feel the service was not interested or able to support me to find solution....I never reported feeling better so they don't know how I am feeling.  
I believe they do not have enough staff resources/counsellors.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Very good service
body: I was grateful for the help and support that this service gave me, the person that rang me was extremely helpful and informative, he put my mind at rest and gave me lots of helpful advice.

title: Excellent services given to me and my family
body: I am very grateful to be registered in a surgery where staff members will go the extra mile to meet my requirements and expectations. The doctors are very efficient and on time and they know what they are doing. Finally I would like to thank the surgery members for their hard work and dedication ..... especially during this Covid-19 Pandemic.

title: Fantastic service
body:
I have been having CBT treatment over the phone for 16 weeks. The practitioner i had was absolutely amazing.Tbh I still can’t believe how the treatment worked on me. But it has!
It has turned my life around.Iv gone from the deepest darkest hole of depression.Into a world of light and happiness. Believe me I’m definitely not a “hippy” type I’m not into stuff like this. 
I have had so much help and full attention from my amazing practitioner/counsellor. Iv been able to free myself from things that Iv held on to all my life. Honestly it feels incredible.my physical pain is so much easier to control now.
I would like to thank my practitioner/ counsellor for all her help. It’s been a fantastic experience. I really have learnt so much. And it’s all down to you. 
We are incredibly lucky to have this fantastic service on the NHS.I’m so grateful.Thank you

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Teddie2004
title: Didn't listen
body:
Every time I have had contact with them I keep having to tell administrative staff it's Miss not Mrs.  
If thats not bad enough -I then received a letter and guess what it's addressed to MRS!  
As for the doctor I have seen, I felt that they also didn't listen and was very patronising.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: l0singella
title: My Coronavirus Test.
body:
I am 12 years old and woke up with a sore throat and high temperature, so I had to get a Coronavirus test. My dad booked me a test at Ards Hospital, and got an appointment that day. When I arrived we were called forward. I was a bit scared. Eilish introduced herself and made me feel comfortable, she described what she was going to do with the swabs and comfirmed my details. The swab wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be as she was very gentle. I got my results through today, thankfully they were negative.  
Thank you Eilish and the swabbing team.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fantastic walkin centre
body: Had shingles Friday got seen Saturday a quick diagnosis by wonderful nurse got meds for it then home in 30 mins brilliant

author: Lynfn93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: the care  recieved
body:
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Very happy with 'Seeing the whole me']  
  
[Very happy with 'Team work']  
  
[Very happy with 'Being listened to']  
  
[Very happy with 'Involved in decisions']  
[Very happy with 'Introductions']  
  
[Very happy with 'Staff skills']

title: Professional
body: As usual my appointment was carried out efficiently and with no problems,the nurse was friendly and helpful and carried out the task quickly and efficiently

title: Great Practice
body:
I had a letter advising i needed a Smear test - called up the same day and the appointment was booked for 3 days later. Arrived, very COVID friendly with the check in screen. Really friendly receptionist (and funny!) The doctor was brilliant, very kind and professional. Made me at ease (as much as you can do with a Smear!) 

There is so much bad press for doctors surgeries but i cannot praise and thank Parkwood enough.

title: Annual Flu jab
body: Only waited a few minutes, nurses very friendly, as they always are, jabbed ,pain free, and away in a nano-second.

author: AUser
title: Looking for info on staff
body: The NHS GGC site contains no info on which consultants are working in which departments, their qualifications, special interests and any contact numbers. Previously lived in Norfolk and all this info was available.

title: Well organised Practice
body: My visit was for flu vaccination and I was impressed with how well things had been organised, in keeping with the covid restrictions.

title: Great practice
body:
Your help will stay in my heart forever.Thanks for your attention and care. I appreciate your professional care. I'm grateful that you were my therapist.You helped me get out of a rut.Your help in my recovery is sincerely appreciated.
I thank you wholeheartedly. I’m really touched beyond words. My heart keeps thanking you for your kind support.

Words are not enough to express my gratitude

title: Great experience
body:
Over the weekend I unfortunately pulled my back. I went to the local A&E which helped with the I initial pain but was directed to my GP for follow up pain management. I phoned the Surgery yesterday to ask if I could have a copy of the A&E Attendance Letter and while it couldn't be emailed to me, the reception staff printed it and had it waiting so my wife could collect it. I asked if I could pre book an appointment for today but was informed that they did not have any pre-bookable appointments left but suggested I use the "eConsult" System. I filled in the phones yesterday and was told someone would make contact with me.
I was a little unsure if I would get a call.so I phoned the surgery this morning and I was informed by the lovely receptionist that not only had they received my eConsult form but I was on the list for one of the clinicians to call me and I was on the early list for a call. so each time I contacted about this issue I had a great experience from the reception staff to the clinician I spoke to. Thank you for making what could have been a really challenging situation incredibly easy!!

title: Very good service
body:
There have been one or two hiccups but generally speaking the requesting of repeat prescriptions by email has worked well.
I am very grateful for being notified about my availability for the annual flu jab. I did not have to wait too long for an appointment. I was seen exactly on time and was on my way within minutes. Excellent service and much appreciated.Thank you!

title: Very good practice
body: Doctors and nurses very thoughtful and highly efficient feel  you have been listened to easy parking nice receptionests on the phon cant find anything wrong at all

author: dw20
title: My experience of Pinewood
body:
Not one single nurse spoke to me longer than a minute to discuss my needs, care plan, why I'm being detained, how long I might stay, what support I can expect.  
- What will my support be like?  
- Who decides what happens to me, their name and contact?  
- Who can help me speak up about what I want?  
- How do you keep me safe?  
- What do I do if I don’t feel safe?  
- What are the rules I have to follow?  
- Who can help me speak up?  
Haven't been helped to understand my Care Plan from an Independent Mental Health ﻿ Advocate or a family member.

readBy.name: Kent and Medway NHS and Social Care Partnership Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Great all round
body: I had a colonscopy. Everyone was so helpful from the moment I entered. Staff stopped to show the way.All procedures were clearly explained with only one exception. Prior to admission I should have been made aware that paracetamol should not be taken within 6 hours of the procedure. The published leaflet did not make this clear but I was outside the timescale. I was as comfortable as possible during the procedure, able to follow clearly by watching on screen. Everyone was relaxed and friendly. The debriefing was clearand I left with the impression of a department which although busy put the patient clearly first. Thank you

readBy.name: The Royal Bournemouth and Christchurch Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great doctors
body: Excellent service by a great doctor . I moved from another surgery and am so glad  that I did,  would recommend this surgery to anyone.

title: Wonderful practice
body:
Called for flu jab at appointed time to find all staff very efficiently organised. Covid precautions in place at every step.
Hand wash and temperature taken then directed to Covid secure distanced place for the actual procedure. All staff correctly attired and extremely reassuring and helpful.  
That's Lockwood's standard anyway.  On this unique occasion they " raised the bar" and cleared it.  Gold medal practice.
Got to be in the top ten in the country.

title: Almost enjoyable
body: I had a colonoscopy in the afternoon of Saturday Oct’ 17th. Everything was explained clearly. I was treated with the utmost care and dignity and cheerfulness. I have had this procedure 3 times previously and this time was the least uncomfortable and least unpleasant. In the recovery area the the wonderful care continued. Please give my thanks to everyone in that department.

title: Excellent Medical Service & Care
body:
Can't fault my day patient arthroscopy experience.  The care and medical team had agreed to work on a Sunday to help with the backlog resulting form Covid-19.  The care and medical service was outstanding.
One small issue - the WiFi there does not work - I must have tried x20 times to log on and it just crashes.  Not the end of the world but it it useful for contacting relations.
Otherwise many thanks to everyone.

title: Efficient and reliable
body: I am so pleased with the surgery and how they are adapting to changing times. I have had fantastic care from the practice doctor and practice nurse, they are so efficient and caring. The reception staff are also fantastic always so helpful and friendly. I am very lucky to have a great GP surgery. Thankyou

title: Good information
body: Phone call today with results of blood tests.  The information was clearly given, with opportunities to ask questions, which were fully answered.  I was encouraged and enabled to make my own choices about the next steps in the process.  A very helpful person-centered approach.  Thank you

title: Well organised flu jab
body: I found the organisation on this particular visit to be very good and it felt like a safe environment. It was a smooth, quick visit.

title: Excellent practice
body: We only visited the surgery for our flu jab, all the staff were very happy and light hearted when asking the necessary questions, in and out very quickly, no fuss. Excellent clinic

title: Friendly over the phone
body: Recently had to call twice to speak to the appointments team and the secretaries. Both times they were so polite and went out of their way to help me and the phones were answered promptly.

author: Jstew
title: The Section that saved me
body:
I was held by NHS Forth Valley under a Section 28. Although I didn't know it at the time, and fought against staff and the system, I was experiencing a manic episode. I arrived at the Hospital under the supervision of Police Scotland in handcuffs.  
Dr Shankar immediately recognised the symptoms, I was initially held for a weekend which quickly extended to a month. It took me days to realise that this was for my own good. NHS nursing staff and Consultants provided me with world class care and looking back I can say in absolute confidence that I owe them my life.  
The stay in the MHU (Mental Health Unit) was life-changing. Staff were friendly and welcoming. I spent time on Wards 1 and 3. I'm grateful to Nurses Fiona and Mark, and Student Alex (who was brilliant) on Ward 1. On ward 3 the list only grows, Dr Ayeer seemed to understand me better than any other Consultant at that point. Ward 3 Nurses are too many to count. A few assistants and students stand out. Nurses Noé, Lucinda and Iona—my thanks. Every member of staff deserves mention here. I've picked a few because they went above and beyond, but really all NHS and Serco staff were brilliant.  
Mr Loughran, without you I wouldn't have been capable of accepting my condition. And finally, Dr Shankar thank you. I knew I could trust you the moment I saw you.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: How do you get an appointment?
body:
Impossible to arrange a doctors appointment. I ring at 08.30 and the phone system is already full. When I eventually get on the queue after 20 minutes and then get through the queue all appointments are taken. This has happened repeatedly. 
When I question the system with staff I am told that all practices operate like this, but a brief Google search shows this is not true. 
You need to change your “no forward booking of appointments” policy.

title: Fantastic Female GP & Referral Administrator
body: I recently contacted the GP after having a spout of different ailments occur at once (and during COVID!). One in particular involving the inside of my knee. I have raised the issue with GP's before at another practice and had also visited  Kingston Hospital who weren't useful and resulted in a "Consultant" sending me home unable to walk. I contacted my GP who sped the process up and arranged an MRI, something I have been needing for 11 years to finally work out the problem. This GP listened to me and all of my symptoms and rather than talking over me which makes the entire process so much easier. As a result I will now be having physio and lots of it! I couldn't be more grateful to my GP at Langley's and the Referral Administrator for being so prompt! Thanks again!

author: Mirena
title: Mirena coil removal
body: Treated today in Lincoln County hospital at the hysteroscopy clinic by Ahia, Sharon and Nicky. Mirena coil removal planned (was hoping for a relatively easy process). The ladies were brilliant. Put me at ease quickly, explained the process brilliantly (clear, concise, simple), very caring, and professional. The procedure was completed and I feel there wasn't any other way they could improve my experience.

title: Excellent experience
body: This practice has handled the covid 19 situation very well, appointments are easily given when needed and doctors are very good with telephone appointments. Thank you!

title: Very helpful
body: Came into Surgery Outside Area and was met by a nurse and told exactly where to go. Asked a few questions about coronavirus and directed to see the doctor for my flu jab. Very efficient and only took a couple of minutes. All done within 5 minutes from arrival

title: Very reassuring appointment with lovely doctor…
body: I needed clarity on some routine questions that had been worrying me. Doctor listened, and really answered my concerns. Thank you.

title: Rude
body:
Rude receptionist, staff arrogant and no appointments available at all, staff need more training and they need to act up right 
Fix up

title: First class telephone communication.
body: Polite professional and very understanding with old people allowed for the lack of communication skills at our age and gave sound and easy to understand advice. Thank you.

author: Libbyslider72
title: Care provided to all patients
body:
After a long 18 month of my Brother James being diagnosed with Cancer he had came to the end of his journey and with all our hearts broken he could not fight any longer, he was 53 when he sadly passed away in the care of the Ayrshire Hospice.  
My Mum and dad and brother could never express how grateful we were to all the staff in the Hospice especially Sandra for the excellent care and the dignity that was shown to my brother was by far the best we could have asked for, My mum and dad had the comfort of knowing that he was in no more pain and was being treated with dignity and respect by all staff and was made so comfortable in his final days, May I also say that me and my brother had the comfort of knowing that while my mum and dad stayed by my brothers bed side that all staff were there to support them at this difficult time for them.  
I know at this time with the COVID-19 it is very difficult for everyone and with myself and brother only being allowed in for a brief bit to say our goodbyes and to be allowed to the window, we had the comfort knowing the staff were there to also support our Mum and dad, We as a family can not thank all at Ayrshire Hospice enough for the excellent care that my brother received but also for all the work that they provide all patients.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Cookie6
title: Mum's care & treatment
body: My Wheelchairbound elderly mum of 84 years old was admitted to Northwick Park on Saturday 10th October.   Care of all the staff was outstanding and she was very well cared for.   Thank you to all in Dickins Ward

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Super practice
body: I had my flu jab on 17th October. Very impressed with outstanding service, so efficient, only 5 minutes from start to finish. System superior to last year.

title: Flu jab
body: Turned up Saturday for regular flu jab and was slight apprehensive due to the covid restrictions but needn’t have worried. Everything worked like a well oiled machine. No queuing, straight in, jab and straight out. Excellent. Thank you.

title: Care Concern and Kindness
body:
At the present time there is only telephone consultations over the  with a doctor after speaking to the reception to request. I telephoned for my husband and received understanding.
I was asked for my husband to come to the telephone to explain his situation. Without any trouble he was promised a doctor would telephone to speak to him personally that day.
The doctor telephoned and the condition was discussed and advise given by the doctor.
Excellent service from the reception doctor and nurse.
So grateful and relieved . 
I also find emails can resolve issues to rather than telephoning when the enquiry or request is not urgent.

title: Flu and pneumonia jabs
body: We were impressed by the safety, speed and efficiency of the friendly personalized service we were given.

title: Dysfunctional practice
body:
This surgery is the worst surgery I’ve ever had to deal with they leave items out of repeat prescriptions I am for ever having to chase up when Certain medication has changed you can never get through on the phone consultant at Portsmouth hospital has requested a change of prescription tablets this was over a week ago still nothing from surgery you have one department for the secretary you have one department for the reception you have another department for prescriptions and they don’t operate untill 1 o’clock my mother is 86 years old
Needed her new blood pressure tablets over a week ago. Can’t get through still waiting disgusting

author: Crazyblonde84
title: Serious changes need to be made
body: My Grandmother was admitted to hospital for a UTI she then came home with nothing on her discharge sheet. She was in for over a week. She came home and within 30 hrs she was admitted back due to a gastric bleed she was then moved from ward to ward and ended up being left to soil herself and had a catheter. Even when the catheter was removed she was still left to soil herself with no help at all. Left to lie in it was her words. Then asked to roll to the side so they could change her. She lost all dignity. We also believe she contracted herpes there which we were never told about she had no medication for this till I got her home and had a doctor visit. I got her home and she used the commode that night. I’m disgusted in the care she received. Not helped to brush her teeth was shocking and to come home with a virus like that when my sister in law is pregnant is unforgivable. Serious changes need to be made.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Poor service and attitudes
body:
It may take several days before you get through on the phone it just rings and rings... an audience with the Pope is more likely than a appointment with a Dr.
The policy is to send you to walk-in centres or A&E anywhere but the surgery. When you get to A&E or the walk-in you will receive a lecture how it's not thier job to subsidise the work load of Pilgrims way.
Receptionists have bad attitudes when they finally do answer the phone, even asking what your problem/illness is before agreeing to appointments! surely a patient's condition is confidential between the Dr and Patient... If you win the lottery and you get to see a Doctor it may not be your own GP, but to be honest all the doctors are very professional and good at thier jobs.  it's just so damned hard to get to see one!

title: Waited ages then passed off
body:
I waited months for an appointment.  Was getting close to the end of my tether.  Then they offered me an external referral.  I gave it a go but they were clueless.  I have very personal issues and they referred me for group therapy.  Right, I’m going to open up in there.

I told them that I wasn’t going to do the group therapy and they discharged me.  On my own AGAIN.

I know that COVID-19 is causing problems but I’ve just been abandoned.  Thanks for nothing.  I’m discharging you! 😡

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Consistent follow-up
body: Was contacted by consultant as part of monitoring medication for a diagnosis of Polymyalgia Rheumatica and was able to report back to the consultant, receive her analysis and be given the further progress in reducing the medication in line with established practice.

title: Surgery cancelled
body: Told my surgery by Colorectal surgeon cancelled due to not knowing if the Gynaecology surgeon is back of sick leave it took me 30sec to find that yes he was but no l couldn't have the surgery as planned as they had given my slot to someone else this surgery was originally booked for last March and if only the surgeons were truthful and admitted to my face they don't want to operate on me as risks are high perhaps l would accept the situation but no they just keep arranging appointments then cancelling and me turning round and saying l won't have the surgery I'm just left in the same pain and discomfort l have been in since last October 2019 to this day October 2020

title: Lack of interest and poor communication
body:
I heard good things about this surgery from local moms when I moved into the area so I registered my family despite the long waiting list. After registering I was told to make appointment for each family members (each of us on different days as that is what's available) but the receptionist failed to notice my son's DOB. I arrived with my son on the day of his appointment to then be told by the nurse that child under 2yo do not need initial assessment. It was such an inconvenience as I've had to skip my son's nap to make the appointment on time when this could have been avoided had the receptionist paid attention.

A few months ago I made a phone appointment with a GP for my son.There was no allocated time given, I missed the phone call and was left with a voice message from the GP to return her call. However I was not instructed with which number to call back on. Naturally I called back the number from the voice message. I was spoken to in a rude tone and told to call the surgery and not the GP's direct line as if I should know this. It doesn't help after that the surgery line was continuously unavailable. It is hard enough to get an appointment in the first place and such poor connection is frustrating. When I eventually able to speak to the GP, the consultation was rushed and she told me that she didn't have the time to let me read through a letter by a private consultant my son had seen while we were abroad on holiday. Instead was told to email the letter to the surgery, not directly to her, so the surgery can redirect it to a centralized system. Had she cared to know the content of the letter, she could have prescribed the medication suggested by the consultant which is available in pharmacy and could have offered relief to my son whilst we wait to hear further from NHS. 

Today I was greeted rudely from a middle aged man who had a go at me for pressing the buzzer too many times. When I tried to speak, I wasn't given a chance to explain myself and was accused of not reading the sign on the door. I was then dismissed like a small child and asked who am I there to see. I apologised and explain myself to the nurse who saw me: Parts of the buzzer was broken and I wasn't sure which button to press and if it was working so have accidentally buzzed too many times. I suggested to the nurse for the sign on the door to be clearer by explaining that although the buzzer looks broken it is working and to inform which specific button to press ie the white one? the two small round bits exposed in the broken section? Maybe put a sign or sticker? Or better change to a new buzzer. I really didn't appreciate being spoken to in such manner. One can express one's frustrations or make a point in a polite and kind manner. Please be mindful on how you speak to a person. You never know what the person is going through. He or she may be going through a hard time and such negativity has a ripple effect that doesn't serve anyone.  
I've yet to have positive experience.

title: Flu jab leaflet
body:
I was given a leaflet about appointments at the surgery in these difficult times. Paragraph 3 talks about my having an annual review but I have never had or been offered one. 
Have I been given the wrong information?

author: Trucky
title: Attending eye casualty
body:
I suddenly lost my sight in my right eye. I attended eye casualty after a two hour wait I was finally seen only to be told there was too much blood in my eye to see the retina, they didn't know what was happening, I was told to come back two days later on the Friday. On arrival Friday after a very worrying two days with no vision I was made to wait over two and a half hours whilst patients with appointments much later than mine which was 13.45 hours were seen before me.. I had to ask to be seen! On seeing the junior doctor I was again told no change, eye still bleeding I would have to wait until the following Thursday, another six days to see another Dr who only holds a clinic once a week on a Thursday!! Surely this could have been organised on the Wednesday!!!  
I am still blind in my right eye, I feel like I've been brushed aside with what is surely a medical emergency with complete loss of sight in one eye!! Incidentally my job is an international truck driver will I will not be able to do if my sight loss becomes permanent!!  
This situation is stressful, traumatising for myself and my family and I feel like it has not been dealt with correctly.  
I wouldn't advise anyone with an eye emergency to attend Northampton!!!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Great treatment
body: Had to have ultrasound and can’t thank the nurse enough for her kindness,courtesy ,and patience with me.Thank you so much.                 David Robson

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wait times and email systems
body: After two phone calls where wait times were 45 min+ Bosmere informed me they had not received an email from the x-ray/scanning clinic and their suggestion was to book me in for an emergency doctors appointment so the Doctor could re-refer me. However on calling them back to say this could use an appointment up for someone else and use up valuable doctors time. Bosmere then located the email that was sent 10 working days ago and put this down to Bosmere rushing to look for the email on the previous two occasions. Thank you I'm really greatful you found the email.

title: Not a happy place
body:
Today I visited the eye clinic. I visit a few consultants every year and I have to say that the eye department is the worst of all. The hostile attitude from receptionists & the nurses who mutter awful things about elderly patients in front of other patients. 

The doctors and eye experts are amazing - but there is something fundamentally wrong with this department. 

I have been a patient for 5 years here now and it’s always the same level of toxic atmosphere. 

The music is too loud in the waiting room, most patients are elderly and the nurses are coming out and shouting names getting frustrated. 

Also, yes there’s a pandemic - but I are the additional barriers in place actually protecting the reception team? No because they wander out of their offices and fail to socially distance anyway. 

The extra barriers are hazardous to patients with eyesight problems. A mask, the gel and the screens are absolutely good enough and this is what other NHS reception desks have. And it works.

author: Dome
title: No answers
body: I had a phone consultation regarding my COPD. I told the doctor how I have been feeling and that I get out of breath and struggle to breath sometimes and had a lot of chest infection. All I got was no answers to my questions.

title: Not great
body: Has taken me 2 months to get registered at this doctors as I’ve recently moved house. Each time I phone and explain I do not own a printer I get told I’ll get a phone back or a snotty response on a email off on how my forms on in order. 2 months to register at a doctors is a disgrace especially when needing to be in regular contact with a Gp due to suffering with PTSD.

readBy.name: Cheshire and Wirral Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body:
We have now left the Horsley area and wanted to say a big thank you to everyone at Horsley Medical Centre for the care and support we have received over the past 25 years.  We have never felt less than well treated by the team and there has always been a strong commitment to listen and help us.
We recognise that these are extraordinary times and are therefore so grateful for the commitment and care our NHS has provided.  Horsley Medical Centre has been our first stop for 25 years and so thank you to all the team.
Our departure is thus tinged with sadness that we will have to look for a new GP in West Sussex.
Rupert and Jane Eastell

title: The Practice is a disgrace !
body:
Even allowing for the current difficult times this Practice is a disgrace. 
Unable to ever get through on the phone and even once you get into reception and get onto an urgent call back list you still get no response.There is absolutely no interest in helping you and they seem to rely on patients using 111 and walk in centre.
Thank goodness for the Putnoe Walk in Centre.
I am definitely registering elsewhere !!

title: Good practice
body: Went for my flu injection ,quick and no waiting staff friendly .Felt safe going in one way out another Covid safe .Thanks You to all staff .

title: Rude telephone reception staff
body: Have called on a number of occasions - phone reception staff rude, abrupt and quite unhelpful. Doctors are lovely but you have to get past the first line which lacks care or understanding

title: Very good
body: On Saturday it was very well organised and professional and the staff very polite ,I only wish the car park was a lot bigger so you could park a lot easier

title: May as well not exist
body:
0830-0912  Have attempted to call 21 times so far. Always engaged.
Better not take blood pressure for a while. It will be through the roof!

title: You're all rockin' 'n rollin' : it's a 10 from me!
body:
An instant of rushing and a bad habit of leaving pan handles wrongly positioned led to a bubbling hot oil spill across my foot. OUCH! AND within days I had a swollen, very painful and whiffy infected foot. The determined doctor gave me half a dozen weekly phone calls, arranged repeated swabs and prescribed the right antibiotics for the rare staph bacteria strain. Nurses dressed the wound. Step-by-step, this has been arranged by the very kind reception team, who also processed weekly photos of the burn for the doctor. No-one complained about about the bother I'd caused.
I'm really proud to say loud 'n clear that I'm a patient of Hall Green Health! They really are heroes and stars, well worthy of the 'silver screen' on channel 5. 
PS Heartlands A&E and QE Burns Centre and Microbiology have also played their part in this healing.
PPS and then, out of the blue, HGH reception team phoned me and arranged jabs for flu and pneumonia.

title: Friendly but ?
body: Can never book an appointment on line or by telephone now, on phone your kept on hold for ages costing money !!, As I'm only on benefits too !

title: Great check in
body:
Looked after immediately and settled in quickly. The operation went well but then everything went sour. 
I wasn’t told (or don’t remember because of the anaesthetic) being told how to look after my wound.   I only saw one nurse briefly between the op and discharge.  I wasn’t given any paperwork for my wife to read about aftercare and whether I would need a checkup, discharge was rushed and I had no idea where to tell my wife to bring the car.

author: Happy and confident
title: Pre-assessment appointment
body: I arrived at the suite and was welcomed by Jackie, she was very approachable and friendly. During my appointment she made me feel comfortable and at ease and answered all my questions professionally. Couldn't have asked for better quality of care, she was brilliant. I now feel more confident about having the operation due shortly. Keep up the good work.

title: What a joke
body:
For the last 2 weeks I have experienced bad headaches/migraines. I have tried time and time again to get through on the phone and when I do I’m on hold, I lasted 40 minutes, before hanging up. I came into the surgery to be told to phone back at 2pm. I know when I phone back I won’t get an appointment as it’s for emergencies only. I’m not one to go to the doctors but when I need to I should be able to get an appointment! 
I appreciate everyone is under pressure at the moment however this practice I have been with for over 20 years and it has never been so bad. Merging with another surgery hasn’t made a difference it’s worse. Please all I ask is that I’m able to see a doctor. 
This seems to be the main complaint of this practice so apologising isn’t enough

title: Caring and professional attention to detail
body:
All medical and nursing staff not only undertook their duties in a professional manner but as importantly spent time and and treated me personally as a patient explaining matters in a friendly manner.
Well done to ALL. 23Hour Ward is the tops!

title: Something wrong with the phone system?
body: Is there something wrong with the phone system because my mother can't get through using her landline, I have tried from my house as well and after 20 seconds the voice menu changes to busy tone, we cannot even get as far as the queue number until it cuts out. This happens every time from 2 different landlines. The only phone that works is my mobile, so my mom cannot phone in by herself.

title: Great practice
body: I am always listened to and given appropriate care. They saved my life by calling for an ambulance twice when I didn't even realize I was having a heart attack.

title: Very unhelpful
body: We do not live within easy travelling distance of any of their clinics/hospitals.  It seems to be a case of like it or lump it.  If you are unable to fit in with them they do not want to know you.  I have had private treatment in the past and have been made to feel a valued ‘customer’.  Alas, it seems that GP Care Ltd are only interested in monetary value and not a good partner for our hardworking NHS.

title: Rude receptionists
body: I have rang the practice trying to get advice an speak to a doctor for 2 weeks now and everytime I ring the receptionists at consistently rude and dismissive, talking over me and not allowing me to ask simple questions without being interrupted. Even their tone of voice is very condescending and it seems to be everytime I call. It makes me very anxious to call the practice.

title: Well managed
body:
My wife and l attended for a flu jab.Great organisation together with a friendly staff made us feel safe and welcome.Thank you all.
     F and M Lauder

title: Annual flu vaccination
body: The practice was very well organised for the throughput of patients requiring their annual flu vaccination. All of the staff were professional, patient and friendly. Never would have imagined such a well organised operation. Impressively orchestrated.

title: Excellent organisation
body: I recently attended the surgery for my annual flu jab. The organisation and efficiency was first class.
